passage:
(1) Bacteria are microscopic single-celled organisms that exist virtually everywhere on Earth. They play a tremendous role in maintaining the balance of our ecosystems and are essential for all life forms. Bacteria help decompose organic matter, recycle nutrients, and even contribute to the formation of certain foods like yogurt and cheese. Without bacteria, dead plants and animals would not break down, and the nutrients within them would not return to the soil.

(2) In nature, bacteria display remarkable abilities to adapt to various environments. They occupy diverse habitats ranging from hot springs to frozen Arctic ice. Some bacteria can even survive in radioactive waste. These microorganisms are capable of converting nitrogen from the air into forms that plants can use, a process known as nitrogen fixation. This biological process is vital for plant growth and agriculture, as nitrogen is a key element in fertilizers.

(3) The human body is home to trillions of bacteria, collectively known as the microbiome. These microorganisms are not random invaders but rather important partners in maintaining our health. The gut microbiome, for example, helps digest food, produces certain vitamins, and protects against harmful pathogens. Recent research has shown that the bacteria in our digestive systems may also influence our immune system and even our mental health.

(4) Despite their beneficial roles, some bacteria can cause diseases. Pathogenic bacteria are the source of many common illnesses, from strep throat to tuberculosis. However, it's important to note that harmful bacteria represent only a small fraction of all bacterial species. The discovery of antibiotics in the early 20th century revolutionized medicine by providing a way to combat bacterial infections, though the passing of time has led to concerns about antibiotic resistance.

(5) Scientists continue to improve our understanding of bacteria and their potential applications. Biotechnology uses bacteria to produce medicines, clean up environmental pollution, and develop sustainable energy sources. Genetic engineering allows researchers to modify bacteria to produce insulin and other valuable proteins. As our knowledge of these elegant microorganisms expands, so does our ability to harness their capabilities for solving global challenges in health, agriculture, and environmental conservation.

questions.question: Which verb form correctly completes this sentence? 'She _____ English for five years.'
Choose the correct form: 'If I _____ more time, I would travel more.'
Which sentence is grammatically correct?

options.C: He didn't went to school yesterday.
options.D: We didn't see the movie last week.

questions.question: Select the correct relative pronoun: 'The book _____ I borrowed from the library was very interesting.'
Which word correctly completes this sentence? 'I'm not as tall _____ my brother.'
Identify the correct passive form: 'The teacher _____ the test tomorrow.'
Choose the correct modal verb: 'You _____ smoke in hospitals.'
Which sentence uses the present perfect correctly?

options.A: I have seen that movie yesterday.
options.B: She has lived here since five years.
options.C: They have never been to Japan.
options.D: We have bought a new car last month.

questions.question: Select the correct preposition: 'I'm going _____ vacation next week.'
Which sentence contains a mistake in subject-verb agreement?

options.A: The number of students in the class is increasing.
options.B: Each of the books are available in the library.
options.C: Neither John nor his brothers want to go to the party.
options.D: The committee has made its decision.

questions.question: Choose the correct form: 'By this time next year, I _____ my degree.'
Which sentence uses the past continuous correctly?

options.A: I was cooking dinner when the phone rang.
options.B: She was study when I arrived.
options.D: He was slept during the lecture.

questions.question: Identify the correct article usage: '_____ umbrella I bought yesterday is broken.'
Which sentence contains a correct use of reported speech?

options.B: He told me that he will come tomorrow.
options.C: They said they are going to the beach.
options.D: I asked if she has finished her homework.

questions.question: Choose the correct form: 'I wish I _____ more free time.'
Complete the sentence: 'She arrived late _____ heavy traffic.'
Choose the correct phrasal verb: 'Can you _____ the children while I go shopping?'
Select the best word to complete this sentence: 'The meeting was _____ due to bad weather.'
Which expression is used to make a suggestion?

options.A: Why don't we go to the cinema?

questions.question: Choose the correct collocation: 'She _____ a mistake in her calculations.'
Complete the idiom: 'It's raining _____.'
Choose the correct connector: 'He studied hard, _____ he failed the exam.'
Select the best expression to show agreement: 'I think we should start the project soon.'
Choose the correct quantifier: 'There isn't _____ milk left in the fridge.'
Select the correct question tag: 'You've been to London, _____?'
What does 'tremendous' mean in this sentence? 'The storm caused tremendous damage to the coastal area.'
Which field is 'biology' related to?

options.B: the study of rocks and minerals

questions.question: What does 'display' mean in this context? 'The museum will display ancient artifacts from Egypt.'
Choose the correct definition of 'improve':
What does 'loyalty' refer to?
What does the verb 'occupy' mean in this sentence? 'Soldiers occupy the abandoned building.'
What is a 'catalog'?

options.A: a list of items with descriptions

questions.question: What does 'organic' mean in this context? 'She only buys organic fruits and vegetables.'
What is a 'manager'?

options.A: a person who cleans an office
options.C: a person who supervises people or activities

questions.question: What is a 'source'?
What does 'random' mean?
What is an 'article'?

options.C: a written text in a newspaper or magazine

questions.question: What does 'elegant' describe?

options.A: something that is graceful and stylish
options.B: something that is old and worn out
options.C: something that is loud and noisy
options.D: something that is cheap and low quality

questions.question: What does 'passing' mean in this context? 'The storm was just passing through the area.'
What does 'capable' mean?

options.B: having the ability to do something

questions.question: According to the passage, bacteria are important because they:
What is nitrogen fixation?

options.A: A process that removes nitrogen from soil
options.B: A bacterial process that makes nitrogen usable for plants
options.C: A technique used to create fertilizers
options.D: A method to kill harmful bacteria

questions.question: The human microbiome refers to:

options.C: trillions of bacteria living in the human body
options.D: bacteria found only in the human mouth

questions.question: What does the passage say about pathogenic bacteria?

options.A: They represent the majority of bacterial species
options.B: They are only found in hospitals
options.C: They cannot be treated with medicine
options.D: They represent only a small fraction of all bacteria

questions.question: According to the passage, bacteria can be used for:
What does the passage suggest about our relationship with bacteria?

options.B: Bacteria are mostly harmful to humans
options.C: Most bacteria are beneficial or harmless
options.D: Bacteria only live in soil and water

questions.question: What concern is mentioned regarding antibiotics?
The word 'microbiome' in paragraph 3 refers to:
According to the passage, what do bacteria in our gut do?

options.B: They help digest food and produce vitamins
options.C: They have no effect on our health
options.D: They prevent us from eating certain foods

questions.question: The main purpose of this passage is to:

options.A: warn people about the dangers of bacteria
options.C: describe the importance of bacteria in nature and human health
